page.title: 10PRODUCE FROM WITTERING FARMS
page.content: The local farms have both livestock and grow a variety of crops. {Manor and Marsh Farms}These farms are run by Mr.Rusbridge.Marsh Farm is the dairy farm with two hundred head of Friesian cattle and one Hereford bull.Manor Farm has fields in which are grown Winter wheat,Winter barley, Spring wheat and peas.Grass is grown for silage and about half of the land is given over to meadow for the cattle.The total amount of land belonging to Manor and Marsh Farms is about four hundred acres. {Grange Farm }Corn is grown on this farm and the farmer also has ninety- five bullocks. {Church Farm }There is no live stock on Church Farm but the farmer grows wheat,oilseed rape and peas that can be dried.
